title: Agricultural Practices- Soil preparation and Transplantation.

subtasks: Learning about agricultural tools and practices
Differentiating between long-term and short-term crops
Describing the stages of agriculture from soil preparation to storage
Importance of seed selection in agriculture
Using flotation techniques for seed selection
Describing wooden plows and leveling tools
Illustrating proper water sorting and root respiration in plowed soil
Discussing soil microorganisms and earthworms proliferation
Showing seed germination and treatment methods
Uprooting and bundling seedlings for transplantation
Introducing paddy planters and their benefits
Ensuring high germination capacity in seeds
Avoiding weed seeds and unfavorable seed traits
Managing seed moisture and quality during storage
Proper seedling care to prevent cracking and drying
Wet jute bag storage for treated seeds
Regular water sprinkling for seed sprouting
Observing seedling development for two to three days
Selecting and testing seeds (including germination test)
Preparing the seedbed (treated seeds, maintaining moisture)
Using plows, leveling tools, and paddy planters

tasks.task: Analyzing Karif and Ruby Season Crops
subtasks: Understanding the difference between short-term and long-term crops
Using aseptic tray methods for seed testing

tasks.task: Describe the process of soil preparation.
Explain the importance of seed selection and perform germination tests.
Detail the process of transplanting paddy seedlings.
Discuss important steps in seed selection and storage.
